android-cloexec-dup.description:
Description

The usage of
dup()
is not recommended, itâ€™s better to use
fcntl()
,
which can set the close-on-exec flag. Otherwise, an opened sensitive file would
remain open across a fork+exec to a lower-privileged SELinux domain.

Examples:

int
fd
=
dup
(
oldfd
);
// becomes
int
fd
=
fcntl
(
oldfd
,
F_DUPFD_CLOEXEC
);
android-cloexec-dup.option:
Static analysis (Clang-Tidy) options are configured via .clang-tidy file.

This rule has no specific options.
